description: Demolition of the existing two-storey garage/outbuilding and erection of a new two-storey outbuilding. Addition of a new high-level side window at ground floor level of the main house.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

A minimum of 3 swift bricks must be incorporated within the external walls of the development hereby approved prior to occupation and must be retained thereafter.Reason: To enhance the biodiversity of the site in accordance with the Kingston Swift (Flagship) Species Action Plan (2023), Policy DM6 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021).

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the Fire Safety Strategy hereby approved and thereafter maintained.Reason: In the interests of Fire Safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire safety) of the London Plan 2021.

The outbuilding hereby permitted shall only be used for a purpose ancillary or incidental or both to the residential use of the dwelling house, unless otherwise first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: the establishment of an additional independent unit of accommodation would give rise to an over-intensive use of the site and lead to an unsatisfactory relationship between independent dwellings in conflict with policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
